programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell puts a plan in motion to net himself a big win. Meanwhile, Ivy changes strategy and focuses on obtaining collectible items.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer wants to sell a coat allegedly made of rare monkey fur. Seth is tempted to make a purchase that could prove beneficial to the finances of the business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The toss of a coin determines the value of a gold chain Les believes is out of fashion. A customer is upset when Seth prevents her from using the staff toilets.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.sub-title: That's the Way the Chicharron Crumbles
programme.desc: Culinary competition, and while signature dish round showcases some barbecue heavyweights. the crossfire and feast of fire rounds serve up some nostalgic classics.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: Martin Bayerle attempts to prove the existence of the sunken treasure by hitting the books and following a historic Russian money trail.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: One team of swampers pursues an alligator that will bring them a state record, while the families of other hunters help out as the season draws to a close.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A record snowfall brings the Coquihalla highway to a standstill and sends shockwaves across the region. Howie leads a team on a dangerous recovery that sparks an unexpected emotional reaction. In Alberta, Adam and Colin have to get a toxic chemical wreck safely back on the road.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a piece of marble from Abraham Lincoln's tomb, an African sword and an antique Charlie Chaplin doll, but are not sure if the sellers are trustworthy.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and the Old Man examine a pipe belonging to President Ulysses S Grant and a shoe from the famous racehorse Secretariat.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman rejects custom-made earrings, as she thought the term diamond cut meant they were diamonds. Seth puts his faith into younger sellers, believing they can outperform Les.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee accidentally cracks the screen of a plasma-screen television. A customer becomes irate when the pneumatic hammer he is trying to sell does not work.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Examining why different cultures have similar tales of monsters and giants, and questioning whether they could be genuine eye-witness accounts of extraterrestrials.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigation into a possible alien visitation to England in December 1980, when Air Force personnel claimed they saw strange lights hovering in the sky.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: When a diver gets tangled in the wreck and another line compromises the propeller, Tim suits up and dives into harm's way, but Martin quarrels over the location of the gold chamber.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a hat belonging to a member of Lynyrd Skynyrd and a sports car.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The experts appraise a collection of vintage toy cars, a pair of First World War German Pickelhaube helmets and a necklace once owned by Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The experts appraise a 1958 Glastron Seaflight boat, a copy of Dracula signed by author Bram Stoker, and a collection of antique billiard items.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee investigates a pirate ship parade float, and the boys are given a chance to cast their eyes over a collection of 17 one ounce silver art bars from the early 1970s.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: There's No Business Like Snow Business
programme.desc: The buyers visit Rimforrest, California where they are hit with a snow storm. Plus, Casey attempts to keep Rene focused and Ivy goes on a shopping spree.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave hits the action hard in a Mojave Desert auction, despite his dislike of the area, while Mary struggles through a locker hoping her profits don't go down the toilet.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.sub-title: That's the Way the Chicharron Crumbles
programme.desc: Culinary competition, and while signature dish round showcases some barbecue heavyweights. the crossfire and feast of fire rounds serve up some nostalgic classics.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man sells Seth some Detroit Red Wings memorabilia, but Les feels that the money offered was too much and some of the items he purchased are just for him and not for resale.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les question Ashley's skills of diplomacy after observing her interact with several customers.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: Martin Bayerle investigates the 1909 shipwreck of RMS Republic, 50 miles off the coast of Nantucket, and attempts to prove the existence of her $1billion bounty.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The conspiracy theories surrounding a UFO sighting in Mexico in 1974. It was reported the object was lost over Coyame, but shortly afterwards a civilian plane crashed nearby.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Places on Earth where aliens may have landed in ancient times, from Mexico's Zone of Silence to the Markawasi Plateau in Peru.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The story of Travis Walton, who claims that in 1975 he was taken aboard a space ship inhabited by extraterrestrial beings. Plus, an analysis of the the Hebrew Bible, which is filled with stories of abductions by otherworldly beings.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The Massachusetts bluefin tuna fishermen return, battling the icy waters of the North Atlantic to land their potentially lucrative catch. The series opener follows the fishermen as they head out to catch the first fish of the season, with captains Tyler McLaughlin and Dave Carraro trying to assert their dominance yet again.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: Three chefs hit the grills for the barbecue contest, serving up some meaty mains, while in the crossfire round, they really need to beef up their game.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: As science turns towards augmenting humanity with technology, theorists suggest that society is merely following the path of its alien creators.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient astronaut theorists look at the Aborigine legend of Dreamtime, and ask if these stories hold the proof that aliens created life on Earth.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod has trouble letting go of the reins after he and Brandi agree to let Alex and Bozek handle the auctions.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hit Torrance for tough competition over only a few quality lockers. Brandi is forced to face her fears when Jarrod gets a locker sure to give her nightmares. Ivy has rarely scored in the area, so he tries a new tactic to change things up. Rene welcomes a pair of new buyers with some not so friendly competition.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Computer games adverts, board games, crosswords and Sudoku books all come under the spotlight, while Dave's jigsaw habit is revealed, and Alan Sugar makes a puzzling appearance.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: David Tennant hosts the satirical news quiz, with guests Phil Wang and Janet Street-Porter joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace, sports presenter Gabby Logan and comedienne Sarah Millican join Frank Skinner for the comedy panel show, competing to banish their pet hates - which include people at cashpoints, barbecues, shop assistants, buffets and anti-social cats - to the infamous room.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Cariad Lloyd and Paul Sinha join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig considers various phenomena. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: In the final episode, Brian joins the Munty Reserve forces, while Barbara and Steg find their own groups to enlist with.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill, as it arrives in Paris.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The competing bidders aim to win two speciality items at auction, including a six-ton trailer. Reality series following a group of rival lock-up enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: T-Money dreams of money when he bids on a huge, chained-up container.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike makes a deal over some taxidermy animals and spots a retro billboard that could be worth a lot of money.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Seattle, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The amateur race arrives into Valkenburg aan de Geul in the Netherlands, traditionally the finish of the Amstel Gold Classic cycling race.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters and the Stig enter a 24-hour endurance race at Silverstone, which proves to be one of their toughest challenges to date. Plus, James May races against BMX bikers around Budapest in a Fiat 500 and Jeremy Clarkson test-drives the Ascari A10. Actor Keith Allen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Beattie Edmondson, Amol Rajan, Gaby Roslin and Hugh Dennis go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy actress Katherine Parkinson, dance guru Louie Spence, comedian David O'Doherty and breakfast news presenter Bill Turnbull join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon. The aim of the game is to hoodwink opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies - like whether Louie makes himself cry before every performance and if David actually is seeing a psychiatrist to cure a strange addiction.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Jeremy Hardy, Barry Cryer and Jeremy Clarkson for more interesting answers on subjects including Birmingham, Bhutan and baldness in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris, Freddie Flintoff and Paddy McGuinness get to grips with a disused hearse, and give it a new lease of life as the ultimate family car. On the track, Chris puts the Dallara Stradale through its paces, while royal couple Zara and Mike Tindall go head-to-head in Star in a Reasonably Fast Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson heads to Italy to get behind the wheel of the exclusive, hand-crafted Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, which is made by coachbuilder Touring Superleggera and based on the manufacturer's already rare 8C Competizione sports car. Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. Comedian Jack Whitehall sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to a series of celebrity guests, as Tim Vine encounters a wet bra, Alice Levine barely attempts cricket and Russell Howard makes a convincing liger.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Beattie Edmondson, Amol Rajan, Gaby Roslin and Hugh Dennis go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes TV presenter Fern Britton, comic actor Robert Webb and broadcaster Danny Baker to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Jeremy Hardy, Barry Cryer and Jeremy Clarkson for more interesting answers on subjects including Birmingham, Bhutan and baldness in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sindhu Vee, Rhod Gilbert and Ed Byrne join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig looks at pathology, the causal study of disease based on the analysis of bodily fluids. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Chris Kamara asks Jon to take part in a Leeds United fundraiser for deprived children. While he's away Lucy tries to enrol Elsie in a private school - against Jon's wishes.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Russell Howard uses ear wax to charm a nice lady called Carol, Asim Chaudhry goes digging for invertebrates and Liza Tarbuck makes a puzzle for children.

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats
programme.desc: Grime artist and chef Big Zuu is off to Portsmouth to cook the perfect post-performance meal for comedian Rosie Jones, including fresh fish and chips just like her Nanna made.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: The local mayor becomes embroiled in a sex scandal, so Boycie decides to stand for election as his replacement - unaware Llewellyn is planning to do the same. Marlene is put in a tight spot when a schoolfriend of Tyler's confesses he has developed feelings for her. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie decides his staff need to work harder and vows to sack the next employee he catches slacking. Mrs Cakeworthy is the first out the door, but she soon has her boss regretting his decision when he learns she is a witch. John Challis, Sue Holderness and Ella Kenion star.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The story of the Ahnenerbe research institute, which was set up to provide scientific backing to Hitler's ideology, through a series of horrific experiments.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Stasi: Behind the Berlin Wall
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston looks behind the hidden remnants of the Berlin Wall, a notorious symbol of division, to tell the story of the Stasi, East Germany's State Security Service.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The hunt for Gestapo head Klaus Barbie and death camp guard John Demjanjuk, dubbed 'The Butcher of Lyon' and 'Ivan the Terrible' respectively, which lasted into the 1980s.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit the Royal William Yard in Plymouth, where they are given the chance to cast their eyes over a number of potentially valuable items. On the waterfront, militaria expert Graham Lay has doubts about a pair of doorknobs thought to have belonged to Admiral Horatio Nelson. The team is impressed by a chess set made from parts of the aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal, and a psychedelic painting of a band that performed at Woodstock intrigues Clive Stewart-Lockhart. Plus, jewellery specialist John Benjamin marvels at a diamond necklace the length of a skipping rope, donated to the city of Plymouth by Lady Astor.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever, including technology that allows the navigation of the winding mountains of Spain at speed..

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents from Plymouth's Royal William Yard. Items brought in to be valued include a ceremonial wooden spoon presented to the student who got the worst exam results in the history of Cambridge University, one of the last flasks of naval rum to be produced, a book of designs by a famous landscape gardener, a ceremonial hammer and chisel and some dolls' house furniture. One visitor discovers the brooch she bought in a charity shop is much older than she thought.

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Documentary examining the animals pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic. In the vast South Atlantic, huge pods of dolphins, massive penguin colonies and the largest gathering of marine mammals on Earth pack chains of extraordinary islands, created by powerful volcanic forces far below them. Meanwhile, the nutrient-rich upwellings create profusions of life in some areas, and the abyssal depths host a world of bizarre creatures in others.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough swims alongside sea otters, discovering he is no match for their natural agility in the water, while in Florida he takes a dip with manatees for the first time and observes their feeding habits. On the coast of California, he encounters the largest mammals on the planet, blue whales, and reveals how they, along with porpoises and dolphins, learned to court, mate and give birth in the water.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador..

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's former deputy Hermann Goering, who emerged from house arrest in May 1945 and made his way to American lines in the hope of surrendering to them rather than the Russians. After being imprisoned at Nuremberg, he committed suicide by poisoning in October 1946.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: In 1925 the SS Cotopaxi carrying coal and 32 men vanished. It has since become synonymous with one of the ocean's greatest mysteries - the Bermuda Triangle.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie secretly buys a load of artificial fertiliser to help his supposedly organic crops - but is seen unloading it by a neighbour, who promptly phones the Agricultural Office to complain about his behaviour. Starring John Challis.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: The local mayor becomes embroiled in a sex scandal, so Boycie decides to stand for election as his replacement - unaware Llewellyn is planning to do the same. Marlene is put in a tight spot when a schoolfriend of Tyler's confesses he has developed feelings for her. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie decides his staff need to work harder and vows to sack the next employee he catches slacking. Mrs Cakeworthy is the first out the door, but she soon has her boss regretting his decision when he learns she is a witch. John Challis, Sue Holderness and Ella Kenion star.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's former deputy Hermann Goering, who emerged from house arrest in May 1945 and made his way to American lines in the hope of surrendering to them rather than the Russians. After being imprisoned at Nuremberg, he committed suicide by poisoning in October 1946.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan is assigned to investigate the case of two murdered teenage girls whose frozen bodies have been uncovered by an avalanche in Norway. Post-mortem results show they were strangled 15 years apart and as investigations proceed, suspicion falls on a friend of one victim's family. Drama, starring Amanda Burton and Anthony Head.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Elizabeth struggles through her labour, while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Negotiations are jeopardised by a twist of fate, and Lizzie learns she has more in common with her husband than she first imagined. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The fusiliers return to the UK and take up guard duty at Windsor Castle, while also preparing to take part in a memorial ceremony for the anniversary of the D-Day landings.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A football match is cut short when trouble arises. Elsewhere, Nelson has problems with his girlfriend, and Paddy faces a few home truths.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jo Masters and Samantha Nixon continue to hunt for the missing Lesley Palmer - a case given added urgency by the subsequent disappearance of her ex-boyfriend Stewart Jenson. Smithy and Laura Bryant discover the unidentified hospital patient is June's real son, while Terry Perkins and Phil Hunter investigate a sudden death - but soon find they also have a burglary on their hands.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Gina asks for more help from Connie as she plans her trip to Switzerland for an assisted suicide, leaving the surgeon with a difficult moral dilemma. Ric learns Bradley has been receiving gifts from the hospital's drug supplier, and the pair's investigation into the medication problem uncovers a counterfeit pill-maker in the warehouse.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Duffy is less than impressed when her doctor husband makes a dramatic entrance on his first day at the hospital, and wonders whether their marriage can survive the stress of a professional relationship. Charlie is forced to come to terms with giving up Louis as he prepares to take the youngster to Canada, and Chloe regrets telling Spencer about Barney's alcoholic father. Medical drama, starring Cathy Shipton and Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Smithy discovers Gabriel's real name is actually David Kent. Understandably taken aback, he nevertheless prevents June from telling Okaro. Unfortunately Laura also knows the truth, and lacks his resolve. Filled with righteous indignation, she blurts out the entire sorry saga to a shell-shocked Sheelagh - who blunders headlong into danger as she investigates. On the professional front, Terry investigates an attack on his sister-in-law.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Jerry's furious with Meena after Gita told him she had an affair with Sanjay. Jules is back in the square and is looking for Hattie. Aunt Nellie causes tension at the Fowler's..

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The fall out of Sanjays affair with Mena comes to a head, when Mena tries to make amends with Gita. David confronts Pat with some harsh truths and Phil suspects Ian's up to no good.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team races to extinguish a blazing marquee at a school fete, but their new gold uniforms make them a laughing-stock for the other crews in attendance.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The Beeches finally becomes a paying concern - but Beth's relief at its new-found solvency is cut short by the discovery that a rival fund-holding trust is stealing patients at an alarming rate. Her frustration is tempered by a growing attraction to newcomer Jack Kerruish - but his professional approach continues to be a source of friction. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna is unsure whether she should tell Luke the truth about his chances of recovery after his near-fatal rugby accident, and Ozias Harding's persistent bullying forces Billy to resign from the factory, leading Nathan to take revenge against the businessman by asking out his daughter Alice. Lesley Dunlop, Brian Capron and Andrew Paul star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon's husband Chris becomes seriously ill, leaving her facing a difficult decision. Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph star in an episode featuring an early screen appearance by Doon Mackichan.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie senses an opportunity to get himself knighted when Marlene becomes heavily involved in charity work. Enlisting the help of their staff, Marlene tries to make it happen using her contacts, but achieving her husband's dream turns out to be harder than expected. Comedy, starring John Challis.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In his latest attempt to impress Nora Batty, Compo borrows Crusher Milburn's bright red motorcycle and dons racing leathers to become a daredevil biker. Comedy, starring Bill Owen, with Kathy Staff.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Compo and Clegg spot Digby chasing his donkey around his paddock. Foggy claims that a little planning will see the beast caught, and volunteers the trio to complete the task. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The detective looks into the suspicious death of an old friend and informant. The investigation leads him to the local police station, where it becomes clear the officers are hiding something - and to complicate matters, the disappearance of a teenage boy is also linked to the case. Crime drama, with Martin Shaw, Lee Ingleby and guest stars Neil Pearson, Dean Lennox Kelly and Mark Benton.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: After Sandra's departure, the detectives are anxious to meet their new boss, and DCI Sasha Miller wastes no time getting cracking with her first Ucos case, the murder of an Italian immigrant on a west London allotment 25 years earlier. The ritualistic style of the killing puts one of the other gardeners in the frame when it's revealed he is a practising druid. However, as the investigation continues, Gerry becomes suspicious of Sasha - why is she kissing a senior officer? Tamzin Outhwaite joins the cast as DCI Miller, with Dennis Waterman, Denis Lawson and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan suspects foul play when she is called in to investigate the apparent suicide of a headmaster's wife. Attempting to arrange a special autopsy, she finds that her superiors don't share her view, appearing more concerned with her failing health _ and without the evidence she needs, a murderer could still be at large. Feature-length episode of the drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis which sees a team of family members from Preston competes to answer questions about top 10 lists, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Ian, Richard, Natasha and Coral pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie and Andrea return, Moira is stung by Cain, and Mandy wants Paul to go.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: David is chased by an angry mob and cornered in an alleyway, while the doctor warns Leanne that it is too soon to be sure, but Oliver may have suffered brain damage. Tommy Orpington assures James he did the right thing coming out, and Chesney urges Gemma to share her vlog online.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Manchester-born brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on an epic journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the fifth episode, Adam attempts to master an ancient sport when he and Scott get a taste of Indian parklife. Elsewhere, Ryan and Dougie make a shock discovery about Dougie's grandmother, before the group join in with the festivities for the country's biggest party for Diwali.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul helps to feed a pair of week-old kittens whose mother has abandoned them. However, as the kittens grow older, the team discover that one of them has a neurological problem affecting his movement. Later, Paul meets a group of dogs from a puppy farm who have had very little human interaction in the past, and need help learning how to socialise.

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: Mercer and his associates are tried for their roles in the killing of 11-year-old Rhys Jones, but the verdict fails to bring closure for the boy's parents Melanie and Steve as the fractures in their relationship come to a head. Meanwhile an unexpected setback leaves Det Supt Dave Kelly with a tough decision to make. The concluding part of the fact-based drama centred on the devastating impact of a child's murder amid a wave of gang violence in Liverpool, starring Stephen Graham, Sinead Keenan and Bran F O'Byrne.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five golfing friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How ancient Greeks invented parchment with techniques still used today. Plus, the making of shuttlecocks.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove continue their hunt through Britain's sheds, searching for nice little earners to buy, restore and flog for a tidy profit. In Somerset they discover Norton motorbikes, Italian mopeds and French go-karts.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove move on to Hertfordshire, where they find vintage cars, obscure tractors and rare British bikes from the 1950s. It's all going well, but when the haggling starts, things don't turn out quite how anyone expected.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Keith Colburn is forced to consider changing his crew after poor fishing and injuries on the Wizard, while Jake Harris struggles to adapt to life on the Northwestern.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin struggles to get his 20-tonne excavator across an extremely busy highway. Elsewhere, Opal Queen Kelly tackles a new challenge with a new partner.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: A concrete and steel walkway drops in one piece, causing issues in Jersey. And in Scotland, blacksmiths search for discarded metal chains to forge into a sculpture.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a rust-free Triumph TR6 sports car from the 1970s that he wants to restore, but first mechanic Edd China has to rebuild the engine.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini checks out a 1933 Duesenberg SJ that has not been taken out on the road for 30 years, and hopes a heated garage has done a good job of keeping the vehicle in top shape.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini flies to Georgia on the orders of a client seeking a 69 ZL-1 Coupe Chevrolet Camaro, and attend the sale of Milt Robson's muscle car collection.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: An insight into the production of Ford's Mustang, which was designed to conform to the firm's objective of building machines that appealed to an international consumer base.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin struggles to get his 20-tonne excavator across an extremely busy highway. Elsewhere, Opal Queen Kelly tackles a new challenge with a new partner.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Ramblin' Rose and Seabrooke suffer engine failures and one boat is permanently handicapped, while Johnathan Hillstrand struggles to keep a promise to his granddaughter.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton hopes to make a handsome profit by selling some of the long-forgotten treasures that lie around his cluttered warehouse.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In a huge barn in Sussex, modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard discovers a large collection of animal-themed curiosities and objects. Then in Cardiff, his favourite kind of antiques are finally revealed.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: An iconic landmark in Bradford, once voted the ugliest building in England, is demolished. Plus, at a factory in Halifax, rusty iron is turned into profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China try to breathe new life into an old VW Beetle.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The VW Beetle begins to take shape as auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and expert mechanic Edd China continue their restoration, but things do not go according to plan.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin recruits his fiance Becky after admitting he is facing serious financial disaster. Elsewhere, the Fire Crew faces deadly snakes and the Cooke Brothers go down deep.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a Kent antiques emporium specialising in unusual European antiques, and indulges in 1940s nostalgia at a home-front museum in south-west Wales.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are scolded when they arrive late for an appointment with Dr Fred. However, once they get past his grumpy assistant, they find themselves in a strange world filled with all kinds of weird and wonderful things.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The transformation of trees into viscose clothing, the production of carbonated cola drinks and the making of traditional English snuff.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacture of cable cars, how a brand of vodka is made from grass, and the functionality of social networking sites.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How the FBI flushed out a deadly sniper who targeted African-American men.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Sometimes blood relations lead to bloodshed - when murder becomes a family affair. Here, investigators turn to forensics to uncover sinister plots within families.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When the body of Fernando Silva was found, the crime scene revealed little about what caused his death. Police turned to CCTV to find out what happened.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murders of retired Michigan police officer Michael Greene and his wife Terri in their home. Police found evidence of a personal grudge as a possible motive for the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Experts uncover evidence linking the abduction of a 10-year-old boy to his father's new wife, after the man became suspicious and raised the alarm.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Jim Boller leads the mission to rescue a deer that has sustained severe injuries after running through a plate-glass window at an office.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to treat a puppy born with a cleft palate, and receives a call from worried lifeguards when snakes hit the beach.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to help a family dog with life-threatening heat stroke, and a terrier with a fear of skateboards. He also needs to collect some alligator saliva.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Monisha has come to Kleinfeld's looking for a dress for her three wedding ceremonies, while Mary has a budget of $30,000 to buy two gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.desc: Couch-lovers Lisa and Vinny are getting wed but had no time to focus on themselves, so style expert George Kotsiopoulos tries to revive them in time for the big day.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Tim has his hands full with some lively little Tasmanian Devils, Chris meets a pug with an overly long tongue and Lisa fears for a ragdoll cat's weak legs.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Feisty meerkats are not impressed by a visit from the vet, a cat needs treatment after being mauled by two dogs, and an angry alligator is brought in for x-rays.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Officer Forester races to save the life of a critically ill cat, Lieutenant Scott tracks down a dog that ran away following an explosion and the team tries to rescue 77 collies.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Officer Sadler discovers what she believes to be fighting cockerels in the back of a pick-up truck, and Lieutenant Scott faces a daring bridge rescue.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A man reports that his 10-year-old daughter has disappeared from his front yard, but police grow suspicious when all the clues point back to him.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The disappearance of Amy St Laurent after a night out with friends in October 2001. Investigators suspected Jeffery Gorman, who Amy had met at a club, of either kidnapping or killing her, but had insufficient evidence to press charges. However, Gorman later made a full murder confession in a telephone call to his mother.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of Brian Williams (aka basketball star Bison Dele) and his girlfriend Serena Karlan, who vanished with their skipper Bertrand Saldo while sailing in the South Pacific in July 2002. Their catamaran was discovered tied up and abandoned at a port in Tahiti. Investigatiors focused their attentions on the only person likely to have information - the missing man's elder brother who had also been on the boat and believed to have moored it.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: Shana Grice was murdered after being stalked by her ex-boyfriend, Michael Lane. He denied involvement, but experts examined police videos to determine the truth.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Katie's sister persuades her to ditch the tomboy look, Courtney searches for a ball gown and Jennifer orders a dress too small for her to make her lose weight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Amy bought a gown elsewhere, before changing her mind, and now she is hunting for her dream dress, while Michelle views her outfit after losing more than three stone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jacqueline goes in search of two dresses of different styles for her wedding, while Christina arrives for her second fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Tara shops with Olympic figure skater and fashionista Johnny Weir, while Taylor brings her fiance Austin to help her find her dream gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: New to wedding dress shopping, Farrah does not seem to know what she wants, while Stephanie's style is vintage glam and she has a clear idea of what to go for.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Natalie is hoping Kleinfeld's will be the last stop on her bridal gown tour, while Amy has lost five stone but still sees herself as overweight.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three collectors spend a day at a market in Sommieres with expert dealer Mark Franks. Back in the UK, they upcycle their items before selling their wares in Winchester.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An insight into the world of high-end pawnbroking, going behind the scenes at a Surrey-based firm dealing in luxurious and exclusive objects.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.sub-title: Steven and Justin's Story - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Steven weighs 800lbs and his brother Justin 600lbs. Desperate to save both his sons' lives, their father travels across the US to seek help.

programme.title: Two in a Million
programme.sub-title: Born with Scales: Two in a Million
programme.desc: Bobbi, 49, and Kenny, 45, have genetic condition lamellar ichthyosis. They travel across the USA to meet for the first time, and begin a life-changing friendship.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A young Mexican man has a tumour on the side of his face the size of a basketball, and in America, Janice a leg that is out of proportion to the rest of her body.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a 14-year-old Regina Walters, believed to have run away from home with her boyfriend. A few months later, her body was recovered and the finger of suspicion eventually pointed to truck driver Robert Rhoades, whose vehicle contained a torture chamber in the back.
